result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L. Scafe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian L. Scafe is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian L. Scafe was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Brian L. Scafe was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Brian L. Scafe was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $600.00 fine plus costs for a total of $1,819.00 on count 1.
1st 10 days without Huber privileges; remaining time with Huber privileges.
Defendant shall not quit his employment without agent approval.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances except those legally prescribed to defendant and take prescribed medications exactly as directed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Not be present where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

Not associate with known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

Comply with any conditions per agent.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

records.addlTxt: PLEA NO CONTEST TO CTS 1, 2 & 5 - FOUND GUILTY - CTS 3 & 4 DISMISSED & READ IN - CT 6 DISMISSED - CT 1 SENTENCED TO 18 MONTHS INITIAL CONFINEMENT AND 18 MONTHS EXTENDED SUPERVISION, IMPOSED & STAYED AND PLACED ON 4 YRS PROBATION W/CONDITIONS INCLUDING TO SERVE 6 MONTHS CONDITIONAL JAIL, 1ST 10 DAYS WITHOUT HUBER, REMAINING TIME WITH HUBER, PAY $600.00 FINE PLUS COSTS - 30 DL REVOCATION - 30 MO IID UPON ISSUANCE OF LICENSE - AA/DSP - CT 2 SENTENCED TO 1 YR INITIAL CONFINEMENT AND 2 YRS EXTENDED SUPERVISION CONCURRENT WITH CT 1, IMPOSED & STAYED AND PLACED ON 4 YRS PROBATION W/CONDITIONS - CT 5 PAY $250.00 FINE PLUS COSTS, BOND FORFEITED AND APPLIED TO CT 5 AND REMAINING BALANCE TO BE PAID BY SEPTEMBER 1, 2016 - JAIL REPORT DATE JUNE 23, 2016 BY 6:00 P.M., 7 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT - INFORMATION FILED AT END OF HEARING
INFORMATION TO BE FILED BY CLOSE OF BUSINESS ON 6/24/16 - COURT ADVISES OF CHARGES/PENALTIES
DEF PRESENT W/ATTY FUDGE - COURT ADVISES OF RIGHT TO PRELIMINARY HEARING - DEF WAIVES RIGHT TO PRELIMINARY HEARING - COURT FINDS PROBABLE CAUSE AND DEF BOUND OVER FOR TRIAL

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed to drive in Wisconsin.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  
DEFENDANT MAY ONLY BE RELEASED ON WEEKDAYS (EXCLUDING HOLIDAYS) FROM 8:00 A.M. UNTIL 4:00 P.M.  DEFENDANT MUST GO IMMEDIATELY TO THE JUSTICE PROGRAMS OFFICE UPON SIGNING OF BOND AND/OR RELEASE.  THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
CURFEW FROM 7:00 P.M. UNTIL 7:00 A.M. EXCEPT FOR WORK, TREATMENT OR TESTING PURPOSES ONLY IF APPROVED BY BOND MONITORING AHEAD OF TIME.
